website_summaries.verdict: A versatile digital caliper that gives you consistent and accurate measurements in the form that's most convenient for you.
pros: Measures in inches, fractions and millimeters
2 sets of jaws for precise measurement
cons: The sliding action is not as smooth as it could be
Some have said the jaws are not flush

customer_reviews.title: Happy Happy Happy
customer_reviews.text: I am a disabled and forced to retire woodworker. As you can imagine my funds are very limited. When my old vernier caliper was badly damaged, I didn't rush to replace it with the first one I found. I researched and shopped online for at least 3 months. All my searches kept coming back to the Neiko 01407A. I could afford it and couldn't wait to get it I was extremely surprised and pleased with the craftsmanship and care that went into the manufacturing process for this tool. I would put this caliper up against any of the high dollar ones. Still making saw dust, Marty Gillan
customer_reviews.author: Marty Gillan

customer_reviews.title: Glitching out
customer_reviews.text: My callipers keep glitching out. Sliding outward works fine at first, but if I try to narrow the gap, the numbers start jumping all over the place- and the measurements become totally innacurate. I've checked that's its not a low battery, and I've never had this issue with other digital calipers, maybe mine is defective. I'm sad because its so slow to use these without messing up the reading, I might as well go back to a ruler.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this to measure a spark plug gapping tool. I measured the gap tool and the gap tool was off from the marks. I set the digital caliper to 0.028" and locked it in place, marked the spot on the gapping tool, and then adjusted the spark plugs. As you can see in the photo the gapping tool marks are off from the caliper. I trust the measurement from the caliper much more than the gapping tool.
customer_reviews.author: GleeG

customer_reviews.title: Not as accurate as I would have hoped.
customer_reviews.text: This caliper does not hold the measurements as I am used to. I also have a General Caliper and I needed a second one. The major problem is this caliper is prone to false readings if you move the adjustable slide too fast. In all fairness they do warn of this in the instructions, I've just never encountered this with the General Caliper I have, so it threw me. If you move the adjusting slide incredibly s-l-o-w-l-y I think it's OK, but I just don't have 100% confidence in it. I am using it to measure overall cartridge length for reloading purposes, and I'd like to be 100% sure that the reading is correct.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie T. Center

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this size unless you have a huge 3D printer or cars or something abnormally large 😂
customer_reviews.text: 😂🤣😂🤣😂🤣😂🤣😂🤣😂🤣😂🤣😂🤣😂🤣😂 This is huge Seriously Like 😂🤣😂🤣😂🤣 the picture says it all Lol wish I had a smaller one but hey free batterie Pros Case Batteries Screen works that’s it lol Cons So large in all forms Deep measuring stick gets in the way if in-depth and outer depth Screen is off or either it’s so large I’m having a hard time getting it on point 😂 The company Neiko could have put there sign somewhere else 😂 because it goes over it Everything about it’s look makes me think pickaxe 😂
customer_reviews.author: TheMortalVirus

customer_reviews.title: Rusted in 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Not quite stainless steel! There are rust spots within 4 months of purchase and the movement is not as smooth anymore - probably because the rust spots are blocking the slider as it has tight tolerances. I was quite happy with the device when I got it, as it looked like reasonably well made, but the steel is a real let down. I can’t imagine this thing will last beyond a few more months. It might work better for people in dryer climates. I live in Singapore where there is high humidity. But to be clear - the device never got wet - just rusted becuase of humidity in the air.
customer_reviews.author: Arvind Mathur

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but keep spare batteries on hand
customer_reviews.text: These calipers have worked well for many years now. They are well constructed and seem accurate enough for my purposes. My only complaint is that every time I go to use them (admittedly only once every few months), the battery is dead. I'm not sure what exactly about the design causes the battery to drain--possibly the case bumps the on/off switch when closed, they don't auto-off properly, or there's just a slight battery drain even when off. If you need replacement batteries, I've found these to be 100% compatible and the best value:
customer_reviews.author: Dane Powell

customer_reviews.title: It’s not a Starrett
customer_reviews.text: Nor a Browne and Sharpe. But hey, I wasn’t expecting it to be. It’s a $20 Chinese set of calipers. I have a Starrett and a Mitutoyo. I was a machinist for 35 years. But I wanted an inexpensive pair for quick measuring around my work shop. The accuracy is about what you’d expect-good to.001. Same with the repeatability. You will need to zero after each use. But for the price and the level of accuracy I am gonna use them for, they’re okay. If you can afford a little more money, look for a used Starrett or Browne and Sharpe. If not, these will do for simple measuring. Thanks for reading
customer_reviews.author: MooseTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, Poor Design & Application
customer_reviews.text: For the price, the build quality outstanding. Product design and reliability? Not so much. It turns on by itself - you'll find the caliper already turned on when you open the box. ANY amount of slight shaking or sudden movement will cause it to reset and/or zero (removing your measurement). It seems it's just a poor product design - specifically around the battery & battery cover.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah K

customer_reviews.title: Very well built digital caliper!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a caliper to assist in my 3d printing. I reviewed the various models on Amazon and decided upon this one due to what others have written about this model. I am happy to inform that the model lives up to it's hype. It feels very solid when held in the hand. The dial that advances the caliper bracket is buttery smooth. The digital display/interface is self explanatory. There is a on/off button, a zero button, and a 3rd button to toggle between measuring in millimeters or inches. Overall, this is a very nice tool to have. I highly recommend this model for anyone out there looking for a digital caliper!!
customer_reviews.author: Like.No.Other

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and versatile.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and features. These have a nice hard and sharp set of jaws that allow for easy marking. The 3 different modes of operation are excellent for different methods of measuring. My table saw fence is based on fractions, but it is easier to set my router bit deapth by thousandths with a dial indicator so this is perfect for both. The ability to use both the front jaws and the rear for deapth is helpful. I like being able to zero and then I can easily account for bit diameter or saw blade kerf. Overall I use these every time I cut wood they are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Langham

customer_reviews.title: Broke sitting in my tool chest drawer
customer_reviews.text: This caliper has never been very accurate, changing readings on the same measurements as many times as the measurement is attempted. "So what" I thought; I only need it for gross measurements. Close enough. BUT THEN, I went to use it for the second time EVER months after purchase, and it just displays nonsense on the readout; no real numbers. Changing the battery, making sure the batt contacts are clean, make no difference. I didn't listen to the review(s) that advised spending a litle more for a stable unit. You can have it for free if you want to pay the shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Hobby Poppy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap garbage that doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: This thing never worked from day one. I assumed it was on account of faulty batteries, but i just got new batteries for it and it still doesn’t work. I got it for jewelry work, and I’m finally now (one year later!) getting to need it and it is an utter failure. The display is dim and depicts nonsense. If I squeeze the (cheap-feeling) plastic housing of the main body the screen activates- but I can’t use it like that. Boo! But also, shame on me for not testing it with fresh batteries sooner so I could ask for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: bobby

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: This is an accurate Digital Caliper, it comes with an extra battery too. Although I don't feel like I will need to use that extra battery anytime soon, it is still nice to know I already have one. The display is large enough for easy viewing, which is a huge perk in my opinion. The only thing that would make this product better would be a backlit for the display, but I also understand that would drive the price up. Overall I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: caleb

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay For Quick Ballpark Numbers...
customer_reviews.text: The unit I received varies wildly in accuracy. Close the jaws all the way, zero it and the digital display will read over 1.5mm off what the printed scale shows. Other times it is within 1/100th accurate. Can't say I have ever seen it be 100% accurate between what the digital and printed scales read. I am waiting on my feeler guage to ship in, so I can check/confirm which scale is the more accurate. But for the price I would have expected it to be at least within 1/10mm accurate. Not super pleased with it. Also not mad or surprised though. The price is 1/10 what I have seen others pay, the accuracy reflects this.
customer_reviews.author: TinyMAG

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I use this for woodworking, and it's amazing for super accurate measurements. It has a zero button, and you can easily switch between metric and inches. For inches, you can choose between fractions or decimals. Readings for inches are to the nearest 1/128th for fractions, and to the nearest 5 one thousandths for decimals. For example the readings just above 5 inches would be: 5-1/128, 5-1/64, 5-3/128, 5-1/32, 5-5/128, etc. for fraction display OR 5.005, 5.010, 5.015, 5.020, 5.025, etc. for decimal display. Readings for metric are to the nearest 1/100th of a mm, such as 3.00, 3.01, 3.02, 3.03, etc.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart
customer_reviews.text: Nice caliper but after a few days of using it a long copper tensioner fell out of the unit. This bent rectangular piece of copper rode between the sliding caliper measurement device and the rail. It's purpose was to create a slight bit of tension so the head piece would hold it's position and not just slide freely from one end to the other. This is important because it makes measurement MUCH more dificult when making small adjustments. Yes this caliper was cheap but my Harbour Freight caliper that I've been using for years didn't fall apart and still functions properly. I wouldn't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the cheapo Harbor Freight model by far!!!
customer_reviews.text: So much better than that junk I've been living with for several years! This one actually stays off when its in its case, so I haven't had to invest in dozens of LR44 batteries like the last one. I also like the fact that most times I turn it on, its actually zeroed! The other one would always be something insane, like -380095.03!!! Also like the nearest fraction setting! Always had to think of what was closest with the last one. Accuracy seems to be spot-on, used a buddy's calipers to check consistency and it was right on the money!
customer_reviews.author: Flyin'Hawaiian

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to provide initial adjustments (preliminary settings) on new control arms prior to installation. At full scale the accuracy failed to repeat itself at times being off as much as 0.01 inches full scale. This is remedied by moving the slide slowly and absent of jerking motions. Other than that it works rather well, and it comes with a decent protective case, and extra battery. For the price it's a good bargain and perfectly suitable for most uses. However, if you are doing some highly exacting work where the requirements for precision and accuracy are more critical, you should also consider higher quality products.
customer_reviews.author: Arby

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: I've needed one of these forever but couldn't justify the price. But this little $23 gauge seems great and quite accurate. Its measurements are repeatable, the jaws are perfectly parallel, and it gave the correct values on some known-diameter 3D printer filament. They even send an extra battery in the case. If the low price scares you, don't be concerned.
customer_reviews.author: 90Below

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, Comes with an Extra Battery and Box
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Mechanical Engineer and pretty picky about things. Was unsure because some of the reviews were saying it wasn't that accurate. I just needed one to measure valve shims with around the house and other projects. It was very accurate for me and perfect for what I needed. Sometimes with longer measurements once the calipers go back to zero it will be .001 something off so you have to zero it, but every digital calipers I have used are the same way. Unless you are really worried about having more than 99.99% accuracy these are great. More likely to have user error than get a bad measurement. Well packaged, nice box to keep them, extra battery, simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Reagan

customer_reviews.title: Budget option.
customer_reviews.text: This tool does what it is supposed to do but I will say that there are definitely better choices out there. One handed operation is very difficult because the wheel doesn’t engage the way it should and it’s very difficult to open in. Closing it is much easier so I had to open it using a two hand method then walk it back with the wheel. Frustrating especially when you’re trying to measure something small. Aside from that, it seems to do what it’s supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Steven N. Hetzer

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and Well Built
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a couple digital calipers in this price range, and the first thing that sticks out is the digital display / microcontroller housing that does the measuring. You'll see it on a couple different brands, which isn't a bad thing - I'm getting readings that are accurate to within .01mm. That's good enough for just about anything other than splitting an atom. This caliper is also bulkier than others I've bought - "heavy-duty" I suppose you could say. It has a nice weight, and the mechanical pieces function smoothly. So I'll say it's the best $20 digital caliper I've ever bought, better than a couple $30 options even. I like calipers.
customer_reviews.author: penile

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, inexpensive caliper for home use!
customer_reviews.text: It's not something I would necessarily use in a precision machine shop, but for general home projects, gunsmithing, and making short work of modifications to my motorcycle, it is very handy indeed! The accuracy is legitimately close to what's listed based on measurements I took of some reference pieces, and this will certainly get the job done in all but the most microscopic of jobs! The large display is worth the money. Get it and don't look back. I wish I had.
customer_reviews.author: WhatsThatNoise

customer_reviews.title: Faulty battery compartment
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice piece of equipment when it worked. The problem was that the battery compartment is made from cheap plastic with a snap-on lid that didn't apply enough pressure on the battery to keep the power on. At first it would work most of the time and turn off occasionally. Then it turned off more frequently until it got to the point that the only way I could use it was to press my thumb against the battery lid, which made it very awkward to use. Changing the battery didn't help. It became so frustrating that I threw it away and bought a different brand with a metal body.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H.

customer_reviews.title: CALIFORNIA Hazardous Materials WARNING, CLICK IT NOW B4U Order!!!
customer_reviews.text: WARNING, it's SO subdued: California residents Click here for Proposition 65 warning the warning should NOT have been something I would have to DIG for After I have it in my, unprotected, hands! Di(ethylhexyl) phthalate, lead and lead products. WASH YOUR HANDS AFTER HANDLING! No wonder there is NOT a picture of the box, front or, especially the back. I felt the need to wash my hands having touched the package! It has light Dusting of some sort of Powder on it! I used gloves to put it back in the box for return, wiped down every surface that I had had the package.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: This is fine, but I can’t help wanting to measure again
customer_reviews.text: It’s precise, does what I need in the shop, but after pushing it back to zero position (not the zero function button) it will sometimes show a negative. Then I zero it back and measure. This is fine, but I can’t help wanting to measure again. ...second guessing after a second measurement is not helpful when you have time constraints. However, it’s measurements have been on point, despite the zero position. This is something I would like to see them fix if I buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Hey They're A Cheap Digital Calipers!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a cheap digital calipers for getting some measurements on rough prototype 3D printing. I have my engineering calipers for the serious work but for knocking around the workbench I wanted something I wouldn't mind getting beat up a bit. The Neiko's accuracy falls within the limits I require but if your trying to measure down to 38μ better get a more accurate caliper. Pro: 1. Cost 2. Accuracy within limits. 3. Features (metric/imperial) 4. Hard shell padded case. 5. Extra battery. 6. Auto Shutoff Cons: 1. Oily coating. 2. Accuracy when you get more detailed. 3. Buttons sometimes get a little "crunchy".
customer_reviews.author: Keith B

customer_reviews.title: Suprisingly high quality build.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice caliper. All metal construction. I have a mitituyo caliper that's old school with just a mechanical dial. It's nice but I prefer this over it cause it will show you fractions as well. I checked the caliper against some new shims stamped .40 , .60. It was on point. A friend I worked with a harbor freight Pittsburg pro digital caliber. It was accurate on the shims we had but all plastic construction. This caliper also come with a nice case. The case seems durable to. Really easy to use caliper here with a quality build to it.
customer_reviews.author: CJM515

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for money, and mine does in fact measure in fractions
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. With any of these cheaper tools my main concern is longevity. Accurate enough for me. I'm not needing .001 of an inch accuracy. Battery installed already and an extra included. Came with a wax type coating probably to protect from rust. You will need to clean that off. Seems like a common question is "what is the display?" Mine measures in mm, decimal inches and fractions by pushing a button. Comes in a "sufficient" plastic case worthy of a $16 tool.
customer_reviews.author: Tophat101

customer_reviews.title: Good caliper
customer_reviews.text: Bear in mind, if you're looking for more precision than this offers, you're looking at the wrong price range altogether. Whether or not it's actually exact down to .001" isn't relevant to my needs. It is consistent, and that is what accuracy really is. All measuring tools are glorified pieces of string. If you understand that, you understand consistency between measurements is the key. I use it for clearance measurements, measuring both pieces rather than the clearance itself, and I get consistent measurements from this caliper. I'm happy with it and would recommend it for anyone who understands the difference between vernier calipers and micrometers, and knows when to use each.
customer_reviews.author: Alton Wroten

customer_reviews.title: Love this tool.
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool, especially at this price point. Accurate is fine against gage blocks over the range. Time to time .001 heavy, but that seems to be just the nature of using this tool. Rechecking generally shows spot on. Should be using my mics for work that close anyway. As for the fractional function. Did not really see any use for that, until I got this caliper. Wonderful thing for sorting and picking out drills! Very handy. I recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Craftsman

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to read, and difficult to use due to lack of Movement Precision
customer_reviews.text: The display is horrible, and the font is tiny compared to normal calipers. Additionally, the movement is very sticky and not smooth, which makes it difficult to get an accurate reading assuming that you can read the tiny font. Not sure who made all these fake reviews as despite being stainless and not plastic it is cheap crap.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas J. Croglio Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great Device at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Since working from home, we've needed an affordable but accurate means of measuring the technical products that we work with. We must confess that we have never heard of Nieico, but the high number of reviews and high number of positive ratings made us take a chance. The Nieco 01407A Electronic Digital Caliper is perfect for our needs. It's easy to maintain, easy to read and operates smoothly. Great device!
customer_reviews.author: R. Aristy

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap pair of calipers
customer_reviews.text: These are accurate enough for me. One thing I love about these that I haven't seen in any other cheap pair of calipers is the fractional mode, where instead of measuring anything below 1 inch using decimals, it automatically converts it to the nearest fraction with a denominator of base 2 (the lower number is 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, etc.). I'm in the US so everything below an inch is usually designated in fractions of an inch, instead of mils/thou (1/1000th of an inch). I use these for measuring things to 3D print accessories for, and so far I have had no problems using them for that.
customer_reviews.author: rutanicus

customer_reviews.title: Best Caliper I've Ever Used!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow ... This caliper is amazing, especially for the price. I've always used a manual caliper, but thought that the digital readout might be handy. It works beautifully! It is exactly as pictured on the ad, high quality steel frame, comes in a sturdy storage box, has a battery in it plus a spare, and the packaging is top notch. I love that the easy to read LCD screen can be switched between inches, millimeters, and fractions. I'm ordering a couple more so I can have one where ever I am. Couldn't be more impressed and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Nebraska Dude

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but it eats batteries
customer_reviews.text: I don't use this caliper very often and when I do I often find the installed battery dead. I thought if it was turned OFF it wouldn't use any battery but maybe I'm wrong? So now I remove the battery before I put the tool away; we'll see if I can get more normal battery life this way even though it is more trouble. Accuracy seems Ok but all I have to check it against is a tape measure. For my use that's alright and it was cheap enough. I could probably have gotten by with a really cheap plastic one but I didn't know they existed at the time. (And those wouldn't use any batteries at all.)
customer_reviews.author: McDork

customer_reviews.title: This is my 2nd one, still junk...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd one, still junk... My first one arrived best to heck and back so I returned it. I need this to measure unidentifiable engine valve shims. To check the accuracy of this tool I used good, new, labeled valve shims from the reputable brand Hotcams. The reading I achieved are way off and completely useless to me on the unlabeled shims. Sometimes it's accurate and sometimes it's not so its not even consistent
customer_reviews.author: Neil Wilkes

customer_reviews.title: An affordable Gem
customer_reviews.text: After leaving my caliper/micrometer outside during a rain storm, I ordereed this to replace that caliper/micrometer. As soon as you move it, the display turns on. If you leave it "on" it will turn itself off. For english measurements it measures all the way down to 1/128 of an inch, which my previous micrometer did not do. Overall I am very pleased with this and will buy another one to make it into a DRO for my drillpress.
customer_reviews.author: carlb

customer_reviews.title: Love these calipers, a must have for reloading and everyday life.
customer_reviews.text: Love this product, I initially purchased it as my go-to calipers for reloading. However, I have found myself using these for everything. The stainless steel body has held up beautifully to regular use, and the multi-functionality of the screen has gotten rid of the headache of making conversions from inches, and metric to fractions. Most recently I used these to measure a welded on nut that is attached to my trailer's leveling jacks. I adjusted the calipers, and scrolled through the units until I found the fractions setting. 15/16 inches the perfect format I needed to go pick up a socket at the local auto parts store.
customer_reviews.author: E.L.

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate and buttons don't work
customer_reviews.text: It came out of the box with the battery installed. The buttons (zero, on/off, unit of measure) do not work. When the on/off button is pressed the display begins oscillating between positive and negative measurements and does not turn off. The zero button is hit and miss but usually misses. Maybe this one missed the quality control inspection so I'll ask for an exchange and see what I get. I must say that it is very sensitive and the resolution is very fine. I do not use it for machining but only to measure diameters and other simple things that a ruler cannot do so I cannot attest to the accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy F Wynne

customer_reviews.title: Completely Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I set the caliper to zero and measured 4.5mm, 5.5mm, 7mm and 9mm chains; even a Lincoln Penny that's supposed to be 19.05mm in diameter and 1.52mm thick with this caliper and all the readings were wrong. Worse, I measured them three different times and the values kept fluctuating each time. This is not a precision instrument. I measured the chains using a steel metric ruler, and the chain measurements were spot on. A ruler gives better results than this caliper.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Did NOT Work. They want me to pay to ship it back. This is a POS
customer_reviews.text: 1st of all I need to declare that I received this. 2nd of all this POS does not work. Press the on button and I get a random number. 0 it out and it zeros out. Move the measuring head and the distance is exactly 0.0.. I tried resetting it– it did not work. tried resetting it again – it didn't work. I tried resetting it again and again and again... It never worked. These guys did not check this before they shipped it. I would not order anything from these guys.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: does what it needs to do (i think)
customer_reviews.text: so this is my first caliper (analog and digital) i bought it to make items in tinkercad for 3d printing. not really knowing what i am doing, the item was easy to use and easy to read. i was able to make my 3d item to spec without any issues caused by the calipers measurements. for its price i would recommend if you need something quick and dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Allen R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery. Top quality. Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I bought them to supplement my collection of old worn, unreliable calipers. Well they repeat!!!!!!!!! No BS for over 42 years I have used almost every brand and quality of calipers. Few ever hit zero when closed “Repeatedly” half thousand display too. Feel is glass smooth. Jaws are fitted and inside and outside pass a ring gauge check without re zero adjustment, I would trust them for .001 accuracy in most uses. I plan to buy some more. And their other size ranges.
customer_reviews.author: Ed S

customer_reviews.title: Great calipers
customer_reviews.text: I really love these calipers. I'm an apprentice machinist, and can't quite afford the fancy stuff yet. Our senior machinists give me a bit of hell for using "cheap ass calipers" but they've served me very well so far, and it's been a few months of daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Kay

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: For value, pretty good. I re-zero it every time but I did that with Mitutoyo calipers anyway, no biggie. And you're not getting a Mitutoyo for less than $95. Case is cheap but fine. The case's inner lining is super cheap but if you're not transporting this often it's not a concern. Comes with spare battery. Cheapo labeling on the back, has wrinkles - like the worker who had that job couldn't be bothered, knowing the caliper would be face-up when it came to last visual inspection before shipping. But for $17 who cares. For the hobbyist, not a pro. If you're working in a pro shop you can afford the good ones anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan M.

customer_reviews.title: Battery base solder came loose.
customer_reviews.text: Battery base solder snapped somehow, so I had to jiggle the battery around to make it work, it was a pain. I tried using these calipers for pinion shim measuring, but they weren't accurate enough kept getting different measurements. for example when i had a 0.031 shim it varied anywhere from 0.029 to 0.034 that is too much variance when it comes to pinion shims. If you want to measure shims I would recommend the non batterie dial type . I bought a fowler dial caliper and it's way more precise. accuracy is within 1 thousands of an inch. which is great for shim measuring.
customer_reviews.author: Erick T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Accuracy for 3D printing/drafting of Parts!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with my 3D printer and measuring objects/spaces to get the perfect fit when drafting up parts. Works great, and is very accurate. The few times I have tried adjusting something manually after measuring, it is either too small or too large. In 3D printing, we are talking down to the 10th of a millimeter accuracy. My only issue is the battery seems to die out when leaving it off for extended periods. I have started to remove the battery when I do not plan on using it for an extended period.
customer_reviews.author: M. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Love This Caliper So Much I Bought the Company!
customer_reviews.text: Well OK not exactly. But I did buy a second one. Great price for an extremely rugged, accurate and easy-to use caliper. I have used it almost daily since purchase two years ago. Love that it converts to mm, inch decimals and inch fractions at the push of a button. Measures inside, outside and depth. This is the one you want!
customer_reviews.author: Sunrise787

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great, but well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: The Neiko caliper works well enough and is accurate although one would think otherwise pre-purchase do to it's cheap price. The build quality is good but don't expect it to be on on par with more expensive brands. Speaking of build quality this was the reason I gave it a 4 star. It is not "weighty" in the hand and the thumb screw gives a bit of a rattle with use. Overall it's a good tool and a great choice to add to the tool bag.
customer_reviews.author: SerenityFade

customer_reviews.title: Depth Gauge is Annoying
customer_reviews.text: This tool is very well constructed and seems accurate. While the depth gauge is also helpful at times, it can also pose problems. I was trying to measure the center bore diameter of a car wheel, but the depth gauge comes out and hits the inside of the rim before getting the full interior bore diameter. If you could choose whether or not that gauge also comes out, it would be perfect. Otherwise, so far that seems like the only flaw for my specific uses.
customer_reviews.author: Isabel Tonelli-Sippel

customer_reviews.title: Love my new Caliper!
customer_reviews.text: As an engineer and product designer, my caliper is an indespensible tool. Up until this point I've only ever used the readily available 6 and 7 inch models. Moving up to this 12-inch caliper is highly convenient. There were so many times where my smaller calipers were just too small, and having precise readings up to 12" has been wonderful. The build quality is top-notch. The caliper feels very solid, unlike most of the cheaper, smaller callers. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality, especially at this price compared to others that are the same price or much higher. Very easy to use, has all the readings and capabilities I needed. My only complaint is they say its “Stainless Steel” yet a magnet will stick to it so its not the non ferris high grade Stainless Steel I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Real Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Good shop Calipers
customer_reviews.text: I had a 6” version of these and had some issues with those but that did not stop me from getting these and I have not been disappointed. If you are a professional machinist theses are probably not for you but if you are a fabrication guy that needs a good set of 12” calipers for the shop then these are a good buy
customer_reviews.author: RWES

customer_reviews.title: Not the nicest and most accurate digital caliper.
customer_reviews.text: When it came I noticed a scratch on the screen right away. The measurement is a little off according to a ruler I based it off of. I know it’s probably not the way to check it but it all I had......very disappointed that it came looking like it was use. If you’re looking for a nice digital caliper I would just go to a hardware store and buy it in person Wish I would’ve done it that way. I guess you get what you paid for. 🤷
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great calipers for Engineering Student Projects!
customer_reviews.text: I am an engineering student and I bought these for a reverse engineering project I was working on and they work great. They are incredibly cheap but still feel solid. If you need perfect accuracy these aren’t for you — I would go with a higher end caliper. But for general use these are great — we also use them in the shop all the time for machining and they get the job done. Just make sure the screws are tightened or they will give inaccurate results.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this caliper four times and now it's dead! Tried three different brands of battery to revive this POS: no response from the digital readout--the thing just went to sleep for ever without the slightest provocation. And of course its been yonks since I bought it, so into the bin goes this sad, poorly-executed "tool". What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: MacMaster

customer_reviews.title: Good Price - But Double and Triple Check Your Measurements
customer_reviews.text: Nice calipers, easy to read, need to recalibrate often (although I always do out of practice). However, their measurements tend to start to wander and vary wildly. Proved this on a known casing that is a "factory control" with correct measurements. As long as you check regularly and have a known control item to check against, not bad for the money. Otherwise, spend the extra and get a high end set of calipers.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Decent, accurate, handy, inexpensive... what more do you need?
customer_reviews.text: My old Mitutoyo calipers were stolen a few years ago, and I wasn't going to drop another $150 for a new set. These Neiko are decent enough, seem to be accurate when measuring known sizes, and were well worth the price. They are a bit stiff out of the box, but were adjustable in tension, and they loosened up after a few days of use. If you're looking for decent calipers and don't want to (or need to) spend big $ on high-end calipers, these will work well for you.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I repair watches (as a hobby) and have used this thing many times now. When you have to know the size of a watch dial or stem, it needs to be exact down to the millimeter. This does inside diamter, outside diameter, and depth! Comes with an extra battery that I have yet to need. The case is great to have too.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Got this to take detailed and accurate measurements to make a replacement part using a 3D printer. Worked exactly as I wanted and with three ways to measure even better. It can measure exterior dimensions, interior, and depth using the three different gauges. Saved the day for us and otherwise we would have had to replace the entire $300 blind corner cabinet apparatus due to a small busted plastic part. The model we have is the metal one which appears well made and reasonably durable.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Accurate, and Worthwhile Tool
customer_reviews.text: This electronic caliper has been extremely helpful in measuring out dimensions to base CAD components on, and all of the components have come out to a perfect fit. The interface is extremely simple with just two buttons clearly labelled for zeroing the caliper out, and transitioning between metric and imperial. In the imperial option you can even choose to have the caliper round to the nearest fraction of an inch which is a great time-saving feature.
customer_reviews.author: Jordyn M

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to use and read and to change units of measurement. I haven’t measured anything yet that allowed me to compare my readings with a standard of sorts. I have only used it so far to measure tread depth on automobile tires. It appears to be well made and I would recommend it for purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SC Gator

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: I am a hobby machinist and have kept this in the case pretty much since Ive bought it. I have a use for it and i go get my new digital caliper (thats now out side of the return date) and it doesn't work right. It reads -35" to sometimes 80 inches all jumping around. IT clearly is broken and now im stuck with a 20$ paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly K King

customer_reviews.title: Terrible battery cover
customer_reviews.text: Battery cover wouldn’t stay on. At some point, it popped off and was lost, but I couldn’t find the manufacturer’s contact info. I randomly called a distributor, and a very helpful employee at Arizona tools is going to send me one. I don’t have much to say about the calipers themselves since I haven’t been able to use them now that they won’t turn on, but I did want to give a shoutout to Arizonatools.com!
customer_reviews.author: winterhorses

customer_reviews.title: Works - but is finicky
customer_reviews.text: The product is cheap, so I can't complain much. when it's working properly it gives very accurate measurements. However sometimes it randomly jumps to wildly different numbers and you have to zero it out again. This happens a lot, but you get used to it. If you're using something for work rather than as a hobbyist, I would recommend getting something nicer. For something you use occasionally to keep at home this works well.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for I guess.
customer_reviews.text: This looked really good and seemed to get good reviews but I'm running into a few problems. Honestly I would hve returned them has I not thrown the packaging away. Every time I open and close them I get a reading of .0005" or 0.0010" even when I zero it each time. These are ok for measuring things where accuracy to this scale isnt needed. I do NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas The Oppressed

customer_reviews.title: I only have one minor complaint with it
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Stainless construction, accuracy, ease of use. Cons: Battery door opens too easily. Spend the extra money here. Don't cheap out with buying plastic jawed calipers. These are worth spending a little extra money for. You might was well just use a ruler otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazon’s Choice sucks
customer_reviews.text: This hooptie little plastic crap device is awful- can’t read the printed Imperial scale for crap when the power is off, and the power WILL be off, because the battery chamber is badly designed and shorts out constantly. If you actually want to measure something, try elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Stucco

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought sooner
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those tools that I always knew I wanted but never really knew it existed. It helps so much in measuring smaller items accurately, especially if you are doing a wood working project or something where you need to know exact dimensions. Definitely something you want to have around because it is very useful when you need to use it.
customer_reviews.author: BobBob

customer_reviews.title: Does not work at all
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at the end of May but did not use it until today (Sept 10 2019). Though it appeared to be packed as new, a closer inspection revealed traces of what looked like "repacking of a returned item" and guess what... I experienced many if not all of the problems other reviewers have experienced plus one: I can't get it to turn off... A quick light touch to the on/off button... still stays on... push and hold the on/off button... still stays on... Waste of US$20 and a piece of unusable junk.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Rice

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely useless, Waste of Money.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is garbage. It was never, ever accurate even once out of the box. The number also jump all over the place once you go past 33mm. I tried changing the batteries and it's still broken. Spend the extra money and get something better. This piece of junk isn't worth your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Can't give same measurement when measuring same brass bar twice
customer_reviews.text: Do not rely on this digital caliper for accurate measurements. Unfortunately my return window has closed so it is a just a loss for me. I really do not understand the high ratings from some people. I took measuring bars from Rockler and used the calipers on them. I would continuously get a different measurement simply by remeasuring the exact same brass bar from the same place on the caliper. Sometimes as much as 0.01 (note that is hundredth, not thousandth) in difference. Mostly I would see about 0.003 to 0.005 in difference by simply measuring and remeasuring the same brase bar. It simply is not consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer named Dale

customer_reviews.title: Great for woodworking
customer_reviews.text: Like a previous reviewer said, my tape measure only goes to 1/16 of an inch. For that purpose this tool does precisely what I need. I have found it very useful for setting up router bits, dimensioning wood for coasters/cutting boards, etc. Love that is has decimal or fractions. Really great for repeated measurements across a project. Would recommend for woodwork.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tool for home use
customer_reviews.text: I recently picked up a 3d printer. This caliper has been great. Simple to use. It converts from MM, to Inch, to Fractions of and Inch (with numerator denominator) with a press of a button. I can quickly measure anything up to six inches. For the home user accuracy I am going for, this thing is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Great price! Accurate - I checked 'standard' machined blocks: zero inaccuracy
customer_reviews.text: Only grump I have about this caliper is the 'fractional inch' readout. For me this is kind of annoying since I frequently design in metric and inch thousandths, though I might imagine a 'home / hobby' purchaser just might finding that scale quite useful. Plus the LR44 button cell is INEXPENSIVE to replace (if your purchase is NOT at a grocery or drug store!): always consider this with 'battery powered' devices.
customer_reviews.author: Droid

customer_reviews.title: World's Least Accurate Caliper...
customer_reviews.text: This caliper is constantly freaking out. I got a lemon here... The display is easy to read, yes, but all I read are the wildly inaccurate measurements. Sometimes it just acts up for no reason, doesn't zero out, and generally doesn't want to behave. I am reviewing this late because i have been trying to deal with this, but its just too annoying to use. Its hitting the garbage can for a better unit.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Nap11

customer_reviews.title: Value proposition for accuracy on a budget.
customer_reviews.text: Seems very accurate and decently well made and good value at the price. Bought it after deciding the similarly-specced Park Tool product was too much at almost three times the price. Comes in a handy protective case that seems durable. Fit and finish could be a tad tighter but measuring seems absolutely precise. Careful not to spear yourself on the very sharply machined points of the calipers. If I have one complaint it's that the short interior calipers on the reverse side need to be slightly longer.
customer_reviews.author: decisivemoment

customer_reviews.title: Mine is defective.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read screen, and I like that it reads inches in both decimals and fractions. Unfortunately I seem to have gotten a defective one, but since I use it infrequently I didn't know until after it was to late to return it. I have only used it 6 or 7 times and it has already developed play in the slide mechanism which makes it nearly impossible to take an accurate measurement. It would be a good tool otherwise, so if you order one make certain to inspect/test it thoroughly before the return window closes.
customer_reviews.author: Phil S.

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, the movement/slide is solid and no slop. One gripe and its not really the tools fault, its very granular, so it will measure to the /128th of an inch. I personally dont need that most times and wish there were a option to measure in like /32nd's or /16ths. Other than that I like it, finding a lot of situations to use it. Would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: John & Nicki Corbin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: This product is worth many times over the asking price. It looks and feels very solid and very smooth movement. Super easy to use and switch between different measuring systems (millimeters, inch, etc). The case this digital caliper is very nice and even has a foam like material on the bottom for the caliper to rest on. I’m extremely happy I went with this product. Great, form and function. Definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Stone

customer_reviews.title: Stainless Steel or Plastic?
customer_reviews.text: These are very useful, but the calipers that I received are definitely NOT stainless steel and are definitely plastic unlike the claims in the advertised pictures. The calipers also don’t have a roller to slide with your thumb making it a little difficult to adjust if you’re just looking to set a measurement, and there is no set screw if you’d like to hold the calipers at a certain measurement.
customer_reviews.author: Jon L.

customer_reviews.title: Battery cover always slides off.
customer_reviews.text: This tool is so poorly designed it's difficult to use. I try to slide the calipers apart and the battery cover constantly slides off. I returned it for the LOUISWARE calipers. Those have a battery cover with screws so I can't slide it off while working.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far this has been working great for us
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been working great for us. The case it comes in is very sturdy and protects the device well. I have not done any comparisons with other devices for accuracy so I can't comment on that. However, for our needs it could be slightly off and it would be fine. We were looking for digital calipers on a budget that would give us better measurements than a ruler (and something easier on our aging eyes). It has not disappointed on this front. I would recommend to anyone with modest measurement needs who is looking for a budget device. For us it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Porcano

customer_reviews.title: After a few uses won't zero or read accurately
customer_reviews.text: Like so many other reviews here. After using it about 10 times the caliper won't zero anymore and sometimes will give crazy readings when trying to caliper items. i cannot recommend this or any Neiko caliper. Listen to the other reviewers here and move to something more expensive but that works!
customer_reviews.author: Cheap-n-Easy

customer_reviews.title: Much better...
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the plastic versions I've been using. The points are tough enough to make a score mark, and seem to be very accurate and (more importantly) consistent in measurement. You can measure the same thing twice and get the same measurement. No head slide.
customer_reviews.author: distorteddogma

customer_reviews.title: The Best Vernier Calipers I Have Ever Used!
customer_reviews.text: Most other digital vernier calipers i have used (lab sort, Harbor Freight, etc.) you need to reset to zero constantly. This one, however, got me a full day's work with always reading zero at the resting position! Slides with very reliable friction, feels sturdy, and packaging is nice. I could easily see this tool lasting me 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Sean *****

customer_reviews.title: Several display options- works perfect
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for setting length of my reloads. As you can imagine, 1.315" means 1.315" - not 1.32". Loaded hundreds of rounds, checking each one, then spot check with an expensive caliper. This one has not missed a beat. You can read SAE (inches) to 4 decimal points, SAE with fractions of an inch and metric. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Cea JaysTop Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, don’t recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Always kept in the box, in my office desk (I have non-digital calipers in my toolbox, and these were my “precision” set) Worked fine for maybe a year. Then started consuming batteries rapidly even when not being used. Replaced the batteries two or three times, now it just flashes random numbers. Should have paid more for a better quality set; lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Hemminger

customer_reviews.title: I use this all the time for 3d printing designs.
customer_reviews.text: Good price, nice piece. I can't vouch for accuracy on a professional level. Not sure I'd use it on a Space Shuttle build but all the hobby stuff I use it for has worked out. Don't get me wrong, I do some very fine measurements for my projects and have never been let down. Just saying, if you're job depends on it, maybe spend more than 10 bucks on this type of tool. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Balmy

customer_reviews.title: If you require precision, pass on this one.
customer_reviews.text: The digital readout is the problem, it’s not too accurate. I can’t trust it. Also, I find that the unit turns itself on by itself, and eventually killed the battery. If you require any sort of precision, I’d recommend an analog micrometer instead of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: It works, nice caliper to always have on hand.
customer_reviews.text: Measure twice with this old girl. This tool is perfect for keeping on hand and knocking around the shop or field, while keeping your nice tools tucked away for when it counts.. When I’m trying to quickly gauge an OD or ID without a care if I’m a blond one off, maybe even a red one. I grab this caliper. In return, if I drop the caliper or spill oil all over it, I didn’t just potentially damage a expensive instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Vince and/or Gina

customer_reviews.title: quality plus
customer_reviews.text: this is great instrument, works great...had my old one, worked for over 40 years...this is greater an easier to use an cheaper too..case an extra battery too...fast shipping, stainless steel...holds zero an is super accurate....great buy.
customer_reviews.author: gene

customer_reviews.title: Great Caliper for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I mainly wanted this to confirm that my 3D printer was calibrated correctly. With this caliper it was easy to figure out what my printers calibration cube measurements were. The entire thing feels solid and heavy. Comes with a case also to keep it in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Nagel

customer_reviews.title: worked fine for a while until ...
customer_reviews.text: worked fine for a while until the readings started jumping around and re-zeroing at various places on the scale ... screen would be intermittent sometimes apart from the re-zeroing. fine for temporary use but I guess i'm going to have to get some mitutoyos
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: too accurate for my use
customer_reviews.text: I am sure its accurate but I can only do so much with fractions. This doesn't want to show the basic fractions. It seems tome that it would be ysed more doe scientific purposes not measuring size- of bolts etc. I will find one to fit my needs and will order it. This one just didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Milsteen

customer_reviews.title: Great, no-fuss digital caliper
customer_reviews.text: I'm not intimately familiar with calipers or how the best ones work, but this seems to be a decent one. Simple to use and understand without reading the instructions, thankfully. Easily measures outer width, inner width, and depth to the millimeter. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great product, fairly good precision
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy caliper. I bought it for a college project and it worked straight out of the box. Easy to read display, easy to use and understand as well. Only reason for 4 over all stars is that it is not the most precise caliper out there, but it’s precise enough for government work. When opening and closing the caliper, it tends to lose its zero, however only by 0.001 millimeters. Nothing too shabby though.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Michael Altman

customer_reviews.title: Did you look at the price tag?
customer_reviews.text: This is just perfect! It is not (depending on the user) 100% accurate. It allowed me to design 3D printed parts and I'm new to this world. The battery last a lot (with proper usage & storage) and it feels like a proper tool, not cheap! Highly recommend for new or experienced users looking for a reliable tool or a spare for the less expensive highly precision jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Bryanne

product_meta.title: Neiko 01407A Electronic Digital Caliper Stainless Steel Body with Large LCD Screen | 0 - 6 Inches | Inch/Fractions/Millimeter Conversion,Silver/Black
product_meta.description: Size:6 inch| Style:CaliperWhen you require exact measuring, you reach for a caliper. But an accurate measurement is meaningless if you can't read it accurately. This caliper takes an essential tool into the 21st century with an extra-large LCD digital readout for exact internal and outside measurements accurate to .001-Inch. Instantly converts from SAE or Metric, the display can be zeroed at any point on the slide. Machine-grooved thumb-roll mechanism and position lock for sure adjustment. Hardened stainless steel shaft with depth-measurement probe, precision ground jaws. On-off switch with auto-off, two long-life batteries included (one spare).
feature_bullets: THREE MEASURING MODES: one button quick change between three measuring modes: inch, fractions, millimeter
PRECISION | ACCURACY: Measurement Range: 0 - 6” and 0 - 150mm; Resolution: 0.0005” / 1/128” / 0.01mm; Accuracy: 0.001” / 0.02mm
STAINLESS STEEL: finely polished stainless steel frame with knurled thumb roller and locking screw ensure smooth sliding and accurate positioning in use
VERSATILITY: measure inside, outside, depth and step with two sets of jaws and the probe
EASY READ VISIBILITY: extra large LCD screen for easy and clear reading
BONUS: extra replacement LR44 battery along with one battery included and custom fit storage case included for better value

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars7,233 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
